and then once that's been accomplished
we'll go ahead and add the rest of the

and we will keep mixing until it all

so if yours does seem super wet and it's

you can add a little more flour

all we have left to do is cover this and

and at this point what we'll do is

and give it another quick need to

and then once we have our dough

options
we could use this right away if we had

what i suggest is transferring this into
some kind of zip top bag and place it in

and i know i probably should have told

going to be able to eat this till

the flavors going to develop and it's

this
so it might grow a little bit in the

something slightly smaller than a golf

and we'll go ahead and sort of rub and
press that on the work surface to
squeeze out all the air
at which point we'll begin a two-step
formation process
and the first step will be to roll this
out to about an eighth of an inch thick
and again using just enough flour to
keep it from sticking
right the one thing that most bad breads
have in common too much flour
so please be careful but having said
that the dough is gonna be sticky so you
are gonna need some
and like i said we're gonna roll that
out to about an eighth of an inch thick
which sounds kind of thin but not even
close to how thin this needs to be
which is why when it gets to this point
we're gonna stop and we'll give that a
little stretch with our hands
and then believe it or not we will lay

and it's over this dome surface where
we're going to stretch this incredibly
thin as in pretty much see-through so it
might take you a few seconds to get it
started
but once you do just keep going around
pulling it down
until basically you've stretched it as
thin as humanly possible without it
tearing
and by the way how this is done back in
the old country is the dough is actually
stretched over a round pillow
which is then used to flop it on top of
the grill they used to cook this
but since you probably don't have a

we'll go ahead and use this upside down

but anyway you decide you are after all

but anyway what we'll do once our dough

carefully with floured fingers transfer

iron skillet
all right so we're definitely going high

because this dose so thin this is only

and as that first side cooks you're

oh and if you're wondering why i'm

you probably don't have to sometimes i

if your pen was hot enough you should

and then we'll keep those covered with

and what's going to happen because of

right these would still be pretty good

and be even more supple so i think
